string.value: What do you have to do to start the job you like? Better talk to Olaf in Lith Harbor to find out.
Listen carefully as #p1002101# describes the details of each job. There'll be a quiz afterwards!

You answered #p1002101#'s questions. You need to be at least #bLevel 10#k to be a #bWarrior, Thief, Bowman, or Pirate#k, and at least #bLevel 8#k to be a #bMagician#k. Head on over to the city where you can get your first job! Warriors: Perion. Thieves: Kerning City. Magicians: Ellinia. Bowmen: Henesys. Pirates: Nautilus.

It's not in my nature to babble, so I'll keep this short. You can become a #bWarrior, Bowman, Thief, or Pirate#k at #bLevel 10#k and a #rMagician#k at #rLevel 8#k. Talk to the correct person at the correct town to get the job you want.

Perhaps that was a little TOO short. Fine. Talk to #p1022000# in Perion to become a Warrior, to #p1012100# in Henesys to become a Bowman, to #p1052001# in Kerning City to become a Thief, to #p1032001# in Ellinia to become a Magician, and to Kyrin in Nautilus to become a Pirate.
Clear enough for you? I hope you paid attention. That info is important. Talk to me again when you're ready to answer my questions.

Question one. To become #ba Warrior, Bowman, Thief, or Pirate#k, #bwhat level do you need to be?#k

#L0##bLevel 8#l
#L1#Level 1#l
#L2#Level 10#l

Excellent. Question two. To become a #bMagician#k, #byou need to reach what level?#k 

#L0##bLevel 8#l
#L1#Level 1#l
#L2#Level 10#l

Great work! Are you using a cheat sheet? Haha!
You know, I've always imagined myself as a Warrior, but every now and then, I see myself shooting arrows with a cool bow! 
Here's the next question. #bWhere#k do you go to become a #bBowman#k? 

#L0##bPerion#l
#L1#Henesys#l
#L2#Kerning City#l
#L3#Ellinia#l
You've passed my test. Now it's time for you to decide which job (Warrior, Thief, Magician, Bowman, Pirate) you want. Talk to me once you've made up your mind.
I already addressed this. You can become a Magician at Level 8. But I didn't ask about Magicians, did I?
Whoa, ambitious much? That's way too early to get your first job. Let me spoonfeed you: the answer is 10.
I'd like to see you try to start a job at Level 1... That's way too early.
Well, you CAN still become a Magician at Level 10, but that's a little late. You can actually become a Magician a couple levels before that...
Perion is for Warriors. I went there myself when I was training to be a Warrior.
At Kerning City you'll find a legendary Thief called Dark Lord...if you keep your eyes open, that is. Are you interested in becoming a Thief?
You know, with all those trees they force everyone to climb in Ellinia, you'd expect Magicians to be buff and muscular...but in fact, the opposite is true! Strange, eh?
